html: No one should have to choose between caring for a sick child or family member & missing a paycheck, or even losing their job. That's why @SenatorDurbin & I joined @PattyMurray in re-introducing the Healthy Families Act, which would make sure workers can earn paid sick leave.
text:
No one should have to choose between caring for a sick child or family member & missing a paycheck, or even losing their job. 

That's why @SenatorDurbin & I joined @PattyMurray in re-introducing the Healthy Families Act, which would make sure workers can earn paid sick leave.

html: If you are willing to risk your life for our country and you can do the job, you should be able to serve—no matter your gender identity or sexual orientation.

html: When I was bleeding to death in my Black Hawk helicopter on that dusty field in Iraq, I didn't care if the troops risking their lives to save me were gay, straight, transgender, black, white, male or female. All that mattered was they didn't leave me behind.
text: When I was bleeding to death in my Black Hawk helicopter on that dusty field in Iraq, I didn't care if the troops risking their lives to save me were gay, straight, transgender, black, white, male or female. All that mattered was they didn't leave me behind.

Trump promised Mexico would pay for the wall, not taxpayers.

html: In the end, we survived. We scraped by. And my mother was able to join us (later becoming a proud U.S. citizen). But if President Trump has his way, the same might not be true for countless other scared, struggling families.
text: In the end, we survived. We scraped by. And my mother was able to join us (later becoming a proud U.S. citizen). But if President Trump has his way, the same might not be true for countless other scared, struggling families.

html: I still remember going to the grocery store and counting out our last five $1 food stamps to buy as much bread and bologna as possible—then praying we’d have enough to last the week.
text: I still remember going to the grocery store and counting out our last five $1 food stamps to buy as much bread and bologna as possible—then praying we’d have enough to last the week.

html: Having a warm meal at night quickly went from being a given to a godsend. I still remember the hours my dad spent walking from payphone to payphone, hoping to find enough spare change for me and my brother to be able to afford the 25-cent school lunch the next day.
text: Having a warm meal at night quickly went from being a given to a godsend. I still remember the hours my dad spent walking from payphone to payphone, hoping to find enough spare change for me and my brother to be able to afford the 25-cent school lunch the next day.

html: When I was a teenager, my dad lost his job, sending our family spiraling into poverty. My father, brother and I soon moved from SE Asia to Hawaii—but my mom was forced to stay back as she wasn’t yet a U.S. citizen

html: As the daughter of an immigrant and someone who depended on food stamps to survive, I refuse to stay silent as the Trump Admin tries to punish immigrant families by changing the “Public Charge” rule.
